 40#ifndef LM_BUILDER_SHAPE_H_
 41#define LM_BUILDER_SHAPE_H_
 42
 43#include <cmath>
 44#include <cstdlib>
 45#include <ctime>
 46#include "core/Math.h"
 47#include "core/Types.h"
 48#include "rdme/Lattice.h"
 49
 50namespace lm {
 51
 52namespace rdme {
 53class Lattice;
 54}
 55
 56namespace builder {
 57
 58// Forward declarations
 59struct point;
 60struct vector;
 61struct matrix;
 62
 63
 64
 65/// @struct point
 66/// @brief Type to store a position in space.
 67typedef struct point {
 68    /// @brief Create a point
 69    /// @param x X location
 70    /// @param y Y location
 71    /// @param z Z location
 72    point(si_dist_t x=0.0, si_dist_t y=0.0, si_dist_t z=0.0):x(x),y(y),z(z){}
 73    si_dist_t x;
 74    si_dist_t y;
 75    si_dist_t z;
 76
 77	/// @brief Create a point from another point
 78	/// @param p2 The point to copy
 79	point(const point &p2):x(p2.x),y(p2.y),z(p2.z) {}
 80
 81    /// @brief Determine the distance squared between two points
 82    /// @param p2 Second point
 83    /// @return scalar distance squared
 84    si_dist_t distanceSquared(const point & p2)
 85    {
 86        si_dist_t dx = p2.x - x;
 87        si_dist_t dy = p2.y - y;
 88        si_dist_t dz = p2.z - z;
 89        return (dx*dx + dy*dy + dz*dz);
 90    }
 91
 92	/// @brief Subtract the vector from the point
 93	/// @param v The vector to subtract
 94	/// @return A new point at that location
 95	point minus(const vector &r);
 96
 97	/// @brief Add the vector from the point
 98	/// @param v The vector to add
 99	/// @return A new point at that location
100	point plus(const vector &r);
101
102    /// @brief Determine the distance to another point
103    /// @param p2 Second point
104    /// @return scalar distance
105    si_dist_t distance(const point & p2) {return sqrt(distanceSquared(p2));}
106} point;
107
108/// @struct bounding_box
109/// @brief The bounds for a shape represented as a rectangular box
110typedef struct bounding_box {
111    /// @brief Create a bounding box for coordinates
112    /// @param x1 Bottom x
113    /// @param y1 Bottom y
114    /// @param z1 Bottom z
115    /// @param x2 Top x
116    /// @param y2 Top y
117    /// @param z2 Top z
118    bounding_box(si_dist_t x1=0.0, si_dist_t y1=0.0, si_dist_t z1=0.0, si_dist_t x2=0.0, si_dist_t y2=0.0, si_dist_t z2=0.0):min(x1,y1,z1),max(x2,y2,z2){}
119    /// @brief Create a bounding box from points
120    /// @param min Minimum coordinate
121    /// @param max Maximum coordinate
122    bounding_box(point min, point max):min(min),max(max){}
123    
124    // Actual points of the bounding box
125    point min, max;
126
127    /// @brief Return a bounding box spanning the two bounding boxes
128    /// @param j Other bounding box
129    /// @return new bounding box
130    bounding_box joinWith(bounding_box j)
131    {
132        return bounding_box(::min(j.min.x,min.x),::min(j.min.y,min.y),::min(j.min.z,min.z),::max(j.max.x,max.x),::max(j.max.y,max.y),::max(j.max.z,max.z));
133    }
134    
135    /// @brief Returns the bounding box volume
136    /// @return volume
137    double volume() { return fabs((max.x - min.x)*(max.y - min.y)*(max.z - min.z)); }
138    
139    /// @brief Retun a random point inside the bounding box
140    /// @return point
141    point randomPointInside() {
142        double rx = (float)rand() / (float)RAND_MAX;
143        double ry = (float)rand() / (float)RAND_MAX;
144        double rz = (float)rand() / (float)RAND_MAX;
145        return point(rx * (max.x - min.x) + min.x,
146                     ry * (max.y - min.y) + min.y,
147                     rz * (max.z - min.z) + min.z);
148    }
149} bounding_box;
150
151/// @struct vector
152/// @brief A vector which points in a direction
153typedef struct vector {
154//////////////////
155// Constructors //
156//////////////////
157    /// @brief Create a vector
158    /// @param x Distance in x
159    /// @param y Distance in y
160    /// @param z Distance in z
161    vector(si_dist_t x=0.0, si_dist_t y=0.0, si_dist_t z=0.0):x(x),y(y),z(z){}
162   
163    /// @brief Construct a vector pointing from one point to another
164    /// @param from The point at the root of the vector
165    /// @param to The point at the end of the vector
166    vector(const point &from, const point &to) {
167      x = to.x-from.x;
168      y = to.y-from.y;
169      z = to.z-from.z;
170    }
171
172	/// @brief Construct a vector from another vector
173	/// @param v The vector to copy
174	vector(const vector &v):x(v.x),y(v.y),z(v.z) {}
175
176	/// @brief Construct a vector from a point
177	/// @param p The point to cast
178	vector(const point &p):x(p.x),y(p.y),z(p.z) {}
179
180	/// @brief convert the vector to a point
181	point toPoint() {
182		return point(x,y,z);
183	}
184
185    static vector findPerpendicularVector(vector v) {
186      if ( fabs(v.z) >= 1.0e-12 && fabs(-v.x - v.y) >= 1.0e-12)
187        return vector(v.z,v.z, -v.x-v.y);
188      else
189        return vector(-v.y-v.z,v.x,v.x);
190    }
191////////////////////// 
192// Unary Operations //
193////////////////////// 
194    /// @brief Get the vector length
195    si_dist_t length();
196
197    /// @brief Get a unit vector pointing in the same direction as this vector
198    vector unitize();
199/////////////////////// 
200// Binary Operations //
201/////////////////////// 
202    /// @brief Compute the dot product between vectors
203    /// @param r The right hand vector
204    si_dist_t dot(const vector &r);
205
206    /// @brief Compute the cross product between vectors
207    /// @param r The right hand vector
208    vector cross(const vector &r);
209
210    /// @brief Scale the vector by a constant
211    /// @param r The scalar
212    vector scale(const si_dist_t r);
213
214    /// @brief Multiply with another vector (taking this vector to be a row vector) to form a matrix
215    /// @param r The column vector
216    matrix mult(const vector &r);
217
218    /// @brief Multiply with a matrix to form a new vector (assuming this vector is a row vector)
219    /// @param r The matrix
220    vector mult(const matrix &r);
221
222/////////////// 
223// Variables //
224/////////////// 
225    // coordinates
226    si_dist_t x;
227    si_dist_t y;
228    si_dist_t z;
229} vector;
230
231
232
233/// @struct matrix
234/// @brief A matrix used for rotations
235typedef struct matrix {
236//////////////////
237// Constructors //
238//////////////////
239    /// @brief Create a matrix with the speficied elements
240    matrix(si_dist_t m11 = 0.0, si_dist_t m12 = 0.0,si_dist_t m13 = 0.0,
241           si_dist_t m21 = 0.0, si_dist_t m22 = 0.0,si_dist_t m23 = 0.0,
242           si_dist_t m31 = 0.0, si_dist_t m32 = 0.0,si_dist_t m33 = 0.0)
243     : m11(m11), m12(m12), m13(m13),
244       m21(m21), m22(m22), m23(m23),
245       m31(m31), m32(m32), m33(m33)
246    {
247    }
248
249    /// @brief Get a forward rotation matrix from angles
250    /// @param phi The angle around x (in radians)
251    /// @param theta The angle around y (in radians)
252    /// @param psi The angle around z (in radians)
253    static matrix eulerMatrixFromAngles(si_dist_t phi, si_dist_t theta, si_dist_t psi) {
254      matrix m( cos(theta)*cos(psi), cos(phi)*sin(psi) + sin(phi)*sin(theta)*cos(psi), sin(phi)*sin(psi) - cos(phi)*sin(theta)*cos(psi),
255               -cos(theta)*sin(psi), cos(phi)*cos(psi) - sin(phi)*sin(theta)*sin(psi), sin(phi)*cos(psi) + cos(phi)*sin(theta)*sin(psi),
256                sin(theta),         -sin(phi)*cos(theta),                              cos(phi)*cos(theta));
257
258      return m;
259    }
260
261    /// @brief Get an identity matrix
262    static matrix Identity() {
263      return matrix(1.0, 0.0, 0.0,
264                    0.0, 1.0, 0.0,
265                    0.0, 0.0, 1.0);
266    }
267
268//////////////////////
269// Unary Operations //
270//////////////////////
271    matrix transpose();
272
273    si_dist_t determinant();
274
275    si_dist_t trace();
276
277///////////////////////
278// Binary Operations //
279///////////////////////
280    /// @brief Multiply by a vector
281    vector mult(const vector &r);
282
283    /// @brief Multiply by a matrix
284    matrix mult(const matrix &r);
285
286///////////////
287// Variables //
288///////////////
289    // Elements
290    si_dist_t m11;
291    si_dist_t m12;
292    si_dist_t m13;
293    si_dist_t m21;
294    si_dist_t m22;
295    si_dist_t m23;
296    si_dist_t m31;
297    si_dist_t m32;
298    si_dist_t m33;
299} matrix;
300
301
302/// @class Shape
303/// @brief Abstract base class for all the shapes in Lattice Microbes simulation builder
304class Shape
305{
306public:
307    /// @enum ShapeType
308    /// @brief Possible shape types that can be used in Lattice Microbes
309    enum ShapeType
310    {
311       SPHERE           =  1,
312       HEMISPHERE       =  2,
313       CYLINDER         =  3,
314       CAPSULE          =  4,
315       CUBOID           =  5,
316       CAPSULE_SHELL    =  6,
317       UNION            =  7,
318       DIFFERENCE       =  8,
319       INTERSECTION     =  9,
320       MESH             = 10,
321       TORUS            = 11,
322       ELLIPSE          = 12,
323       CONE             = 13,
324       UNIONSET         = 14
325    };
326
327public:
328    /// @brief Create a Shape
329    /// @param shapeType The type of shape should be of type ShapeType
330    /// @param boundingBox The extents of the object used for fast collision/contains checking
331    /// @param type The type of site that the object represents
332    /// @param at A vector describing what direction the object is pointing "at"; default: (0,0,1)
333    /// @param up A vector describing what direction is "up" relative to "at"; default: (0,1,0)
334    Shape(ShapeType shapeType, bounding_box boundingBox, site_t type, vector at = vector(0.0,0.0,1.0), vector up = vector(0.0,1.0,0.0));
335    /// @brief Destroy the Shape
336    virtual ~Shape();
337    
338    /// @brief Checks if another shape's bounding box interstects with this shape's bounding box
339    /// @param query The other shape to test
340    /// @return true/false
341    virtual bool boundingBoxesIntersect(Shape * query);
342    /// @brief Check if two shapes intersect
343    /// @param query The other shape to check
344    /// @return true/false
345    virtual bool intersects(Shape * query) = 0;
346    /// @brief Determine if the shape contains the specified point
347    /// @param query Point to test
348    /// @return true/false
349    virtual bool contains(point query) = 0;
350    /// @brief Determine if the shape contains the specified shape
351    /// @param query Shape to test
352    /// @return true/false
353    virtual bool contains(Shape * query) = 0;
354    
355    /// @brief Get the bounding box
356    virtual bounding_box getBoundingBox() {return boundingBox;}
357    /// @brief Get the site type associated with the shape
358    virtual site_t getType() {return type;}
359    /// @brief Get the shape type
360    virtual ShapeType getShapeType() {return shapeType;}
361    /// @brief Get the total internal volume of the shape
362    virtual double getVolume() = 0;
363
364    /// @brief Discretize the object to the specified lattice
365    /// @param lattice Lattice in which to discretize the shape
366    virtual void discretizeTo(lm::rdme::Lattice * lattice);
367
368protected:
369    // Functions used for Monte-Carlo integration of volume
370    double integrateToPercentThreshold(double percent); // Integrate until the fluctuation in value is less than
371    double integrateToCount(int count); // Integrate a static number of steps
372    
373    virtual point minBounds(point p1, point p2) const {return point(min(p1.x,p2.x),min(p1.y,p2.y),min(p1.z,p2.z));}
374    virtual point maxBounds(point p1, point p2) const {return point(max(p1.x,p2.x),max(p1.y,p2.y),max(p1.z,p2.z));}
375    
376    ShapeType shapeType;
377    bounding_box boundingBox;
378    site_t type;
379   
380    // An orientation for the shape
381    vector at; // A vector pointing to where the object is heading
382    vector up; // A vector representing "up"
383	matrix rotation; // The rotation matrix based on Euler angles that converts a point to the same axes as (at, up)
384 
385    friend class LatticeBuilder;
386};
387
388}
389}
390
391#endif

Shape.cpp#

  1/*
  2 * University of Illinois Open Source License
  3 * Copyright 2011-2018 Luthey-Schulten Group,
  4 * All rights reserved.
  5 *
  6 * Developed by: Luthey-Schulten Group
  7 *               University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
  8 *               http://www.scs.uiuc.edu/~schulten
  9 *
 10 * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of
 11 * this software and associated documentation files (the Software), to deal with
 12 * the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to
 13 * use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies
 14 * of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to
 15 * do so, subject to the following conditions:
 16 *
 17 * - Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice,
 18 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers.
 19 *
 20 * - Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice,
 21 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers in the documentation
 22 * and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
 23 *
 24 * - Neither the names of the Luthey-Schulten Group, University of Illinois at
 25 * Urbana-Champaign, nor the names of its contributors may be used to endorse or
 26 * promote products derived from this Software without specific prior written
 27 * permission.
 28 * 
 29 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR
 30 * IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,
 31 * FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT.  IN NO EVENT SHALL
 32 * THE CONTRIBUTORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR
 33 * OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE,
 34 * ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR
 35 * OTHER DEALINGS WITH THE SOFTWARE.
 36 *
 37 * Author(s): Andrew Magis, Elijah Roberts, Joseph R. Peterson
 38 */
 39
 40#include "config.h"
 41#include "core/Print.h"
 42#include "builder/Shape.h"
 43#include "rdme/Lattice.h"
 44
 45
 46namespace lm {
 47namespace builder {
 48
 49
 50point point::minus(const vector &r) {
 51  return point(x-r.x, y-r.y, z-r.z);
 52}
 53
 54point point::plus(const vector &r) {
 55  return point(x+r.x, y+r.y, z+r.z);
 56}
 57
 58
 59si_dist_t vector::length() {
 60   return sqrtf(x*x + y*y + z*z);
 61}
 62
 63vector vector::unitize() {
 64   si_dist_t l = length();
 65   if(l > 0)
 66     return vector(x/l, y/l, z/l);
 67   else
 68     return vector(0.0, 0.0, 0.0);
 69}
 70
 71
 72si_dist_t vector::dot(const vector &r) {
 73   return x*r.x + y*r.y + z*r.z;
 74}
 75
 76vector vector::cross(const vector &r) {
 77   return vector(y*r.z - z*r.y,
 78                 z*r.x - x*r.z,
 79                 x*r.y - y*r.x);
 80}
 81
 82vector vector::scale(const si_dist_t r) {
 83  return vector(r*x, r*y, r*z);
 84}
 85
 86matrix vector::mult(const vector &r) {
 87  return matrix(x*r.x, x*r.y, x*r.z,
 88                y*r.x, y*r.y, y*r.z,
 89                z*r.x, z*r.y, z*r.z);
 90}
 91
 92vector vector::mult(const matrix &r) {
 93   return vector(x*r.m11 + y*r.m21 + z*r.m31,
 94                 y*r.m12 + y*r.m22 + z*r.m32,
 95                 z*r.m13 + y*r.m23 + z*r.m33);
 96}
 97
 98matrix matrix::transpose() {
 99  return matrix(m11, m21, m31,
100                m12, m22, m32,
101                m13, m23, m33);
102}
103
104si_dist_t matrix::determinant() {
105   return m11*m22*m33 + m12*m23*m31 + m13*m21*m32 - (m13*m22*m31 + m12*m21*m33 + m11*m23*m32);
106}
107
108si_dist_t matrix::trace() {
109   return m11*m11 + m22*m22 + m33*m33;
110}
111
112
113vector matrix::mult(const vector &r) {
114  return vector(m11*r.x + m12*r.y + m13*r.z,
115                m21*r.x + m22*r.y + m23*r.z,
116                m31*r.x + m32*r.y + m33*r.z);
117}
118
119matrix matrix::mult(const matrix &r) {
120  return matrix(m11*r.m11+m12*r.m21+m13*r.m31, m11*r.m12+m12*r.m22+m13*r.m32, m11*r.m13+m12*r.m23+m13*r.m33,
121                m21*r.m11+m22*r.m21+m23*r.m31, m21*r.m12+m22*r.m22+m23*r.m32, m21*r.m13+m22*r.m23+m23*r.m33,
122                m31*r.m11+m32*r.m21+m33*r.m31, m31*r.m12+m32*r.m22+m33*r.m32, m31*r.m13+m32*r.m23+m33*r.m33);
123}
124
125
126
127
128// Shape Class //
129Shape::Shape(ShapeType shapeType, bounding_box boundingBox, site_t type, vector at, vector up)
130:shapeType(shapeType),boundingBox(boundingBox),type(type),at(at),up(up)
131{
132  // Determine angles between at and up
133  double phi   = 0.0; // Rotation about x
134  double theta = 0.0; // Rotation about y
135  double psi   = 0.0; // Rotation about z
136
137  // Determine unitized vectors
138  vector Xvec = at.unitize();     // X in the rotated frame
139  vector Yvec = up.unitize();     // Y in the rotated frame
140  vector Zvec = Xvec.cross(Yvec); // Z in the rotated frame
141
142//  std::cout << "X ("<< Xvec.x << "," << Xvec.y << "," << Xvec.z << ")" << std::endl;
143//  std::cout << "Y ("<< Yvec.x << "," << Yvec.y << "," << Yvec.z << ")" << std::endl;
144//  std::cout << "Z ("<< Zvec.x << "," << Zvec.y << "," << Zvec.z << ")" << std::endl << std::endl;
145
146
147  phi   = atan2(Zvec.x, Zvec.y);
148  theta = acos(Zvec.z);
149  psi   = atan2(Yvec.z, Xvec.z);
150
151  Print::printf(Print::DEBUG, "phi:%.4g\ttheta:%.4g\tpsi:%.4g",phi,theta,psi);
152
153  // Determine the rotation matrix
154  rotation = matrix::eulerMatrixFromAngles(phi, theta, psi);
155}
156
157Shape::~Shape()
158{
159}
160
161bool Shape::boundingBoxesIntersect(Shape * query)
162{
163    bool xOverlap = (query->boundingBox.max.x >= boundingBox.min.x && query->boundingBox.min.x <= boundingBox.max.x);
164    bool yOverlap = (query->boundingBox.max.y >= boundingBox.min.y && query->boundingBox.min.y <= boundingBox.max.y);
165    bool zOverlap = (query->boundingBox.max.z >= boundingBox.min.z && query->boundingBox.min.z <= boundingBox.max.z);
166    return xOverlap && yOverlap && zOverlap;
167}
168
169void Shape::discretizeTo(lm::rdme::Lattice * lattice)
170{
171	// Get the starting and ending subvolumes coordinates.
172	lattice_size_t x1 = (lattice_size_t) max(0.0,floor(boundingBox.min.x/lattice->getSpacing()));
173	lattice_size_t x2 = ((lattice_size_t)floor(boundingBox.max.x/lattice->getSpacing()))+1;
174	lattice_size_t y1 = (lattice_size_t) max(0.0,floor(boundingBox.min.y/lattice->getSpacing()));
175	lattice_size_t y2 = ((lattice_size_t)floor(boundingBox.max.y/lattice->getSpacing()))+1;
176	lattice_size_t z1 = (lattice_size_t) max(0.0,floor(boundingBox.min.z/lattice->getSpacing()));
177	lattice_size_t z2 = ((lattice_size_t)floor(boundingBox.max.z/lattice->getSpacing()))+1;
178    
179    // Constrain to the RDME domain
180    x1 = ::max((lattice_size_t)0, x1);
181    y1 = ::max((lattice_size_t)0, y1);
182    z1 = ::max((lattice_size_t)0, z1);
183    x2 = ::min(lattice->getXSize()-1, x2);
184    y2 = ::min(lattice->getYSize()-1, y2);
185    z2 = ::min(lattice->getZSize()-1, z2);
186
187	// Go through each subvolume that contains a portion of this shape.
188	for (lattice_size_t x = x1; x<=x2; x++)
189		for (lattice_size_t y = y1; y<=y2; y++)
190			for (lattice_size_t z = z1; z<=z2; z++)
191			{
192				// If the center of this subvolume is in the cuboid, mark it as part of the shape.
193				point c((((double)x)+0.5)*lattice->getSpacing(), (((double)y)+0.5)*lattice->getSpacing(), (((double)z)+0.5)*lattice->getSpacing());
194				if (contains(c)) lattice->setSiteType(x, y, z, type);
195			}
196}
197
198    
199// Functions used for Monte-Carlo integration of volume
200double Shape::integrateToPercentThreshold(double percent) {
201    double bbVol = this->boundingBox.volume();
202    srand(time(NULL));
203    
204    double totalPoints = 0.0;
205    double pointsInside = 0.0;
206    double volumeThreshold = percent/100.0 * bbVol;
207    double delta = 66e6;
208    double lastChangedValue = 66e6;
209    while(delta > volumeThreshold) {
210        totalPoints += 1.0;
211        if(this->contains(boundingBox.randomPointInside())) {
212            pointsInside += 1.0;
213            delta = fabs(lastChangedValue - (pointsInside / totalPoints) * bbVol);
214            lastChangedValue = (pointsInside / totalPoints) * bbVol;
215        }
216    }
217    
218    
219    return (pointsInside / totalPoints) * bbVol;
220}
221double Shape::integrateToCount(int count = 1000000) {
222    double bbVol = this->boundingBox.volume();
223    srand(time(NULL));
224    
225    // Count fraction of random points that end up inside
226    double pointsInside = 0.0;
227    for(int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
228        if(this->contains(boundingBox.randomPointInside()))
229            pointsInside += 1.0;
230    }
231    
232    // Return fraction of volume that is inside points
233    return pointsInside/count * bbVol;
234}
235    
236    
237    
238}
239}

Hemisphere.h#

 1/*

40#ifndef LM_BUILDER_HEMISPHERE_H_
41#define LM_BUILDER_HEMISPHERE_H_
42
43#include "builder/Shape.h"
44#include "rdme/Lattice.h"
45
46namespace lm {
47namespace builder {
48
49/// @class Hemisphere
50/// @brief A hemisphere Shape
51class Hemisphere : public Shape
52{
53public:
54    /// @brief Create a Hemisphere
55    /// @param center Point center of the circle of the slice plane through the Hemisphere
56    /// @param radius Radius of the Hemisphere
57    /// @param orientation Orientation normal to the center point of the center point in the direction of the curved part of the hemisphere
58    /// @param type The type of the sites within the hemisphere
59    Hemisphere(point center, si_dist_t radius, vector orientation, site_t type);
60    /// @brief Destroy the Hemisphere
61    virtual ~Hemisphere();
62    
63    /// @brief Check if two shapes intersect
64    /// @param query The other shape to check
65    /// @return true/false
66    virtual bool intersects(Shape * query);
67    /// @brief Determine if the shape contains the specified point
68    /// @param query Point to test
69    /// @return true/false
70    virtual bool contains(point query);
71    /// @brief Determine if the shape contains the specified shape
72    /// @param query Shape to test
73    /// @return true/false
74    virtual bool contains(Shape * query);
75    /// @brief Get the center of the Hemisphere
76    virtual point getCenter() {return center;}
77    /// @brief Get the radius of the Hemisphere
78    virtual si_dist_t getRadius() {return radius;}
79    /// @brief Get the orientation vector of the Hemisphere
80    virtual vector getOrientation() {return orientation;}
81    /// @brief Get the volume contained by the Hemisphere
82    virtual double getVolume();
83
84protected:
85    point center;
86    si_dist_t radius;
87    vector orientation;
88};
89
90}
91}
92
93#endif

Hemisphere.cpp#

  1/*
  2 * University of Illinois Open Source License
  3 * Copyright 2011-2018 Luthey-Schulten Group,
  4 * All rights reserved.
  5 *
  6 * Developed by: Luthey-Schulten Group
  7 *               University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
  8 *               http://www.scs.uiuc.edu/~schulten
  9 *
 10 * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of
 11 * this software and associated documentation files (the Software), to deal with
 12 * the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to
 13 * use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies
 14 * of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to
 15 * do so, subject to the following conditions:
 16 *
 17 * - Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice,
 18 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers.
 19 *
 20 * - Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice,
 21 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers in the documentation
 22 * and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
 23 *
 24 * - Neither the names of the Luthey-Schulten Group, University of Illinois at
 25 * Urbana-Champaign, nor the names of its contributors may be used to endorse or
 26 * promote products derived from this Software without specific prior written
 27 * permission.
 28 *
 29 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR
 30 * IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,
 31 * FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT.  IN NO EVENT SHALL
 32 * THE CONTRIBUTORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR
 33 * OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE,
 34 * ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR
 35 * OTHER DEALINGS WITH THE SOFTWARE.
 36 *
 37 * Author(s): Andrew Magis, Elijah Roberts
 38 */
 39
 40#include "config.h"
 41#include "builder/Shape.h"
 42#include "builder/Hemisphere.h"
 43#include "builder/Sphere.h"
 44#include "rdme/Lattice.h"
 45
 46namespace lm {
 47namespace builder {
 48
 49Hemisphere::Hemisphere(point center, si_dist_t radius, vector orientation, site_t type)
 50:Shape(HEMISPHERE,bounding_box(point(center.x-radius, center.y-radius, center.z-radius),point(center.x+radius, center.y+radius, center.z+radius)), type, orientation, vector::findPerpendicularVector(orientation)),center(center),radius(radius),orientation(orientation)
 51{
 52}
 53
 54Hemisphere::~Hemisphere()
 55{
 56}
 57
 58bool Hemisphere::intersects(Shape * query)
 59{
 60    // FIXME: NEEDS TO BE IMPLEMENTED //
 61    if (!boundingBoxesIntersect(query)) return false;
 62
 63    //Sphere * querySphere = dynamic_cast<Sphere *>(query);
 64    Sphere * querySphere = (Sphere *)query;
 65    point c = querySphere->getCenter();
 66    si_dist_t r = querySphere->getRadius();
 67
 68    // If the distance between the two centers is less than the sum of their radii, these two spheres intersect
 69    return (center.distanceSquared(c) <= (radius+r)*(radius+r));
 70}
 71
 72bool Hemisphere::contains(point query)
 73{
 74    // FIXME: NEEDS TO BE IMPLEMENTED //
 75    if( center.distanceSquared(query) <= radius*radius ) {
 76        vector vec = vector(center, query);
 77        if( orientation.dot(vec) >= 0) {
 78            return true;
 79        }
 80    }
 81
 82	return false;
 83}
 84
 85bool Hemisphere::contains(Shape * query)
 86{
 87    if (!boundingBoxesIntersect(query)) return false;
 88
 89    if (query->getShapeType() == SPHERE)
 90    {
 91        Sphere * querySphere = (Sphere *)query;
 92
 93        // Transform the sphere as if the hemisphere was oriented in the +z direction and centered at 0,0,0.
 94        point c = querySphere->getCenter();
 95        si_dist_t x=c.x-center.x;
 96        si_dist_t y=c.y-center.y;
 97        si_dist_t z=c.z-center.z;
 98        si_dist_t r=querySphere->getRadius();
 99
100        // Make sure none of the sphere falls below the xy plane.
101        if (z < r) return false;
102
103        // Make sure the sphere is not closer than r to the hemisphere surface.
104        if ((x*x+y*y+z*z) > (radius-r)*(radius-r)) return false;
105
106        return true;
107    }
108    return false;
109}
110
111double Hemisphere::getVolume()
112{
113    return (2.0/3.0)*PI*radius*radius*radius;
114}
115
116}
117}

Builder Classes#
