 40#ifndef LM_BUILDER_LATTICEBUILDER_H_
 41#define LM_BUILDER_LATTICEBUILDER_H_
 42
 43#include <map>
 44#include <utility>
 45#include <vector>
 46#include "core/Types.h"
 47#include "builder/Shape.h"
 48#include "rdme/Lattice.h"
 49#include "rng/RandomGenerator.h"
 50
 51using std::vector;
 52using lm::rng::RandomGenerator;
 53
 54namespace lm {
 55
 56namespace io {
 57class SpatialModel;
 58}
 59
 60namespace rdme {
 61class Lattice;
 62}
 63
 64namespace builder {
 65
 66/// @class LatticeBuilder
 67/// @brief A class that defines regions of a lattice based on a set of geometries defined by shapes.  It also allows packing different types of particles into different regions. 
 68class LatticeBuilder
 69{
 70protected:
 71    /// @struct ParticlePlacement
 72    /// @brief A representation of a placement operation that needs to occur (i.e. where to place (siteType), what to place (particleType) and how many (count))
 73	struct ParticlePlacement
 74	{
 75    	particle_t particleType;
 76    	site_t siteType;
 77    	uint count;
 78        /// @brief Create a ParticlePlacement placement operation
 79        /// @param particleType The type of particle to place
 80        /// @param siteType The type of site in which to place the particles
 81        /// @param count The number of particles to place in that site type
 82    	ParticlePlacement(particle_t particleType, site_t siteType, uint count):particleType(particleType),siteType(siteType),count(count) {}
 83	};
 84
 85public:
 86    /// @brief Create a Lattice Builder
 87    /// @param xLen Length of the domain along x-axis
 88    /// @param yLen Length of the domain along y-axis
 89    /// @param zLen Length of the domain along z-axis
 90    /// @param collisionGridSpacing The spacing for collision objects
 91    /// @param seedTop High 32 bits of the seed (allows a constant seed for debugging)
 92    /// @param seedBottom Low 32 bits of the seed
 93    LatticeBuilder(si_dist_t xLen, si_dist_t yLen, si_dist_t zLen, si_dist_t collisionGridSpacing, uint32_t seedTop, uint32_t seedBottom=0);
 94    virtual ~LatticeBuilder();
 95
 96    /// @brief Add a region to the lattice
 97    /// @param shape A Shape object to add as a region
 98    virtual void addRegion(Shape * shape);
 99    /// @brief Add an shape to the lattice
100    /// @param shape A Shape object to add as a region
101    /// @return true if the object to place does not intersect another object
102    virtual bool placeObject(Shape * shape);
103    /// @brief Remove the shape from the lattice
104    /// @brief s Shape to remove
105    virtual void removeObject(Shape * s);
106    
107    /// @brief Place a sphere in the lattice (for obstacles)
108    /// @param center The center point of sphere obstacle
109    /// @param radius Radius of the sphere obstacle
110    /// @param type The type of site in which to place sphere
111    /// @return true if the sphere did not intersect
112    virtual bool placeSphere(point center, si_dist_t radius, site_t type);
113    /// @brief Remove a sphere in the lattice (for obstacles)
114    /// @param center The center point of sphere obstacle
115    /// @param radius Radius of the sphere obstacle
116    /// @param type The type of site in which to place sphere
117    virtual void removeSphere(point center, si_dist_t radius, site_t type);
118    /// @brief Place a sphere randomly in the lattice (for obstacles)
119    /// @param radius Radius of the sphere obstacle
120    /// @param type The type of site in which to place sphere
121    /// @param region The region in which to place obstacle randomly
122    /// @return number of times a placement operation occured
123    virtual uint placeRandomSphere(si_dist_t radius, site_t type, site_t region);
124    /// @brief Place many spheres randomly in the lattice (for obstacles)
125    /// @param radius Radius of the sphere obstacle
126    /// @param type The type of site in which to place sphere
127    /// @param region The region in which to place obstacle randomly
128    /// @return number of times a placement operation occured
129    virtual void placeRandomSpheres(uint count, si_dist_t radius, site_t type, site_t region);
130    /// @brief Fill a region with random spheres to a specified volume fraction
131    /// @param volumeFraction Total fraction of volume that should be filled with spheres
132    /// @param radius Radius of spheres
133    /// @param type The type of site to fill (i.e. the type of site to exclude other objects from)
134    /// @param region The region of the lattice to place spheres into
135    virtual void fillWithRandomSpheres(double volumeFraction, si_dist_t radius, site_t type, site_t region);
136    /// @brief Gets a spatial model of the lattice for interface with python.  NOTE: this operation clears the object passed in from python
137    /// @param spatialModel An object of a spatial model for interaction in python or HDF5.  The model will be filled with the current lattice
138    virtual void getSpatialModel(lm::io::SpatialModel * spatialModel);
139
140    
141    /// @brief Add particles of a given type
142    /// @param particleType The type of particles to randomly place in the lattice
143    /// @param siteType Type of lattice site into which to place
144    /// @param count Number of particles to place
145    virtual void addParticles(particle_t particleType, site_t siteType, uint count);
146
147    /// @brief Discretizes the regions to a square lattice
148    /// @param lattice Lattice object into which to place
149    /// @param obstacleSiteType An identifier for obstacle sites in the lattice
150    /// @param fractionObstacleSitesOccupied Percentage of obstacle sites to be filled
151    virtual void discretizeTo(lm::rdme::Lattice * lattice, site_t obstacleSiteType, double fractionObstacleSitesOccupied);
152
153protected:
154    /// @brief Discretizes the obstacles to a square lattice
155    /// @param lattice Lattice object into which to place
156    /// @param obstacleSiteType An identifier for obstacle sites in the lattice
157    /// @param fractionObstacleSitesOccupied Percentage of obstacle sites to be filled
158    virtual void discretizeObstaclesTo(lm::rdme::Lattice * lattice, site_t obstacleSiteType, double fractionObstacleSitesOccupied);
159
160protected:
161    // Lattice dimensions
162    si_dist_t xLen, yLen, zLen;
163    
164    // Regions of the lattice (i.e. cell membrane, cytosol, extracellular space, etc.)
165    std::vector<site_t> definedRegions;
166    std::map<site_t,std::vector<Shape *> > regionShapes;
167    std::map<site_t,bounding_box> regionBounds;
168    std::vector<Shape *> objects;
169    
170    // Particle placement operations or in other words how many particles of each type that should be placed and where
171    std::vector<ParticlePlacement> particles;
172    
173    // Collision objects, collision grid size and percent filled
174    Shape *** collisionGrid;
175    uint * collisionGridSize;
176    uint * collisionGridOccupancy;
177    si_dist_t collisionGridSpacing;
178    double recipCollisionGridSpacing;
179    uint collisionGridXSize, collisionGridYSize, collisionGridZSize;
180    
181    // Random number generator associated with this lattice
182    RandomGenerator * rng;
183
184};
185
186}
187}
188
189#endif

LatticeBuilder.cpp#

  1/*
  2 * University of Illinois Open Source License
  3 * Copyright 2011-2018 Luthey-Schulten Group,
  4 * All rights reserved.
  5 *
  6 * Developed by: Luthey-Schulten Group
  7 *               University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
  8 *               http://www.scs.uiuc.edu/~schulten
  9 *
 10 * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of
 11 * this software and associated documentation files (the Software), to deal with
 12 * the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to
 13 * use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies
 14 * of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to
 15 * do so, subject to the following conditions:
 16 *
 17 * - Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice,
 18 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers.
 19 *
 20 * - Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice,
 21 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers in the documentation
 22 * and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
 23 *
 24 * - Neither the names of the Luthey-Schulten Group, University of Illinois at
 25 * Urbana-Champaign, nor the names of its contributors may be used to endorse or
 26 * promote products derived from this Software without specific prior written
 27 * permission.
 28 * 
 29 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR
 30 * IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,
 31 * FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT.  IN NO EVENT SHALL
 32 * THE CONTRIBUTORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR
 33 * OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE,
 34 * ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR
 35 * OTHER DEALINGS WITH THE SOFTWARE.
 36 *
 37 * Author(s): Andrew Magis, Elijah Roberts
 38 */
 39
 40#include <list>
 41#include <cmath>
 42#include "config.h"
 43#include "core/Exceptions.h"
 44#include "core/Math.h"
 45#include "core/Print.h"
 46#include "builder/Cone.h"
 47#include "builder/Capsule.h"
 48#include "builder/CapsuleShell.h"
 49#include "builder/Cuboid.h"
 50#include "builder/Hemisphere.h"
 51#include "builder/LatticeBuilder.h"
 52#include "builder/Shape.h"
 53#include "builder/Sphere.h"
 54#include "builder/Difference.h"
 55#include "builder/Union.h"
 56#include "builder/UnionSet.h"
 57#include "builder/Intersection.h"
 58#include "builder/Torus.h"
 59#include "builder/Ellipse.h"
 60#include "builder/Cylinder.h"
 61#include "SpatialModel.pb.h"
 62#include "io/SimulationFile.h"
 63#include "rdme/Lattice.h"
 64#include "rng/RandomGenerator.h"
 65#include "rng/XORShift.h"
 66#ifdef OPT_CUDA
 67#include "rng/XORWow.h"
 68#include "cuda/lm_cuda.h"
 69#endif
 70
 71using lm::io::SpatialModel;
 72
 73namespace lm {
 74namespace builder {
 75
 76LatticeBuilder::LatticeBuilder(si_dist_t xLen, si_dist_t yLen, si_dist_t zLen, si_dist_t collisionGridSpacing, uint32_t seedTop, uint32_t seedBottom)
 77:xLen(xLen),yLen(yLen),zLen(zLen),collisionGrid(NULL),collisionGridSize(NULL),collisionGridOccupancy(NULL),collisionGridSpacing(collisionGridSpacing),recipCollisionGridSpacing(1.0/collisionGridSpacing),rng(NULL)
 78{
 79    #ifdef OPT_CUDA
 80    // Create the cuda based rng, if we are using cuda and we have a cuda device assigned.
 81    //if (resources->cudaDevices.size() > 0)
 82   //{
 83		try
 84		{
 85			rng = new lm::rng::XORWow(0, seedTop, seedBottom, lm::rng::RandomGenerator::UNIFORM);
 86        Print::printf(Print::DEBUG, "Seeding xorwow rng with top word %u and bottom word %u", (unsigned int)(rng->getSeed()>>32), (unsigned int)(rng->getSeed()&0xFFFFFFFFLL));
 87		}
 88		catch(lm::CUDAException e)
 89		{
 90			Print::printf(Print::WARNING, "Initializing GPU random number generator failed: %s.  Falling back to CPU random number generator.", e.what());
 91			rng=NULL;
 92		}
 93    //}
 94    #endif
 95
 96    if (rng == NULL)
 97    {
 98        rng = new lm::rng::XORShift(seedTop, seedBottom);
 99        Print::printf(Print::DEBUG, "Seeding xorshift rng with top word %u and bottom word %u", (unsigned int)(rng->getSeed()>>32), (unsigned int)(rng->getSeed()&0xFFFFFFFFLL));
100    }
101
102    // Allocate the collision detection grid.
103    collisionGridXSize = (uint)lround(floor(xLen/collisionGridSpacing)+1);
104    collisionGridYSize = (uint)lround(floor(yLen/collisionGridSpacing)+1);
105    collisionGridZSize = (uint)lround(floor(zLen/collisionGridSpacing)+1);
106    Print::printf(Print::DEBUG, "Creating collision grid of size %d %d %d", collisionGridXSize, collisionGridYSize, collisionGridZSize);
107    collisionGrid = new Shape **[collisionGridXSize*collisionGridYSize*collisionGridZSize];
108    collisionGridOccupancy = new uint[collisionGridXSize*collisionGridYSize*collisionGridZSize];
109    collisionGridSize = new uint[collisionGridXSize*collisionGridYSize*collisionGridZSize];
110    for (uint i=0; i<collisionGridXSize*collisionGridYSize*collisionGridZSize; i++)
111    {
112        collisionGrid[i] = new Shape*[2];
113        collisionGridOccupancy[i] = 0U;
114        collisionGridSize[i] = 2U;
115    }
116}
117
118LatticeBuilder::~LatticeBuilder()
119{
120    // Delete the rng.
121    if (rng != NULL) { delete rng; rng = NULL;}
122    if (collisionGrid != NULL)
123    {
124        for (uint i=0; i<collisionGridXSize*collisionGridYSize*collisionGridZSize; i++)
125        {
126            if (collisionGrid[i] != NULL) {delete [] collisionGrid[i]; collisionGrid[i] = NULL;}
127        }
128        delete [] collisionGrid; collisionGrid = NULL;
129    }
130    if (collisionGridOccupancy != NULL) {delete collisionGridOccupancy; collisionGridOccupancy = NULL;}
131    if (collisionGridSize != NULL) {delete collisionGridSize; collisionGridSize = NULL;}
132}
133
134void LatticeBuilder::addRegion(Shape * shape)
135{
136	// Make sure this region is in our defined list.
137	bool found=false;
138	for (uint i=0; i<definedRegions.size(); i++)
139	{
140		if (definedRegions[i] == shape->getType())
141		{
142			found = true;
143			break;
144		}
145	}
146	if (!found) definedRegions.push_back(shape->getType());
147
148    // Add this region to the list.
149    regionShapes[shape->getType()].push_back(shape);
150
151    // Update the region's bounding box.
152    if (regionBounds.count(shape->getType()) == 0)
153        regionBounds[shape->getType()] = shape->getBoundingBox();
154    else
155        regionBounds[shape->getType()] = regionBounds[shape->getType()].joinWith(shape->getBoundingBox());
156
157}
158
159bool LatticeBuilder::placeObject(Shape * s)
160{
161    // Go through all of the grid volumes that this shape's bounding box intersects with.
162    uint zMin = (uint)lround(floor(s->boundingBox.min.z*recipCollisionGridSpacing));
163    uint zMax = (uint)lround(floor(s->boundingBox.max.z*recipCollisionGridSpacing));
164    uint yMin = (uint)lround(floor(s->boundingBox.min.y*recipCollisionGridSpacing));
165    uint yMax = (uint)lround(floor(s->boundingBox.max.y*recipCollisionGridSpacing));
166    uint xMin = (uint)lround(floor(s->boundingBox.min.x*recipCollisionGridSpacing));
167    uint xMax = (uint)lround(floor(s->boundingBox.max.x*recipCollisionGridSpacing));
168    for (uint z=zMin; z<=zMax; z++)
169    {
170        for (uint y=yMin; y<=yMax; y++)
171        {
172            uint index=xMin+(y*collisionGridXSize)+(z*collisionGridXSize*collisionGridYSize);
173            uint maxIndex = index + xMax - xMin;
174            for (; index<=maxIndex; index++)
175            {
176                Print::printf(Print::VERBOSE_DEBUG, "Checking box at index %d",index);
177
178                // Go through all of the shapes in this volume and see if we have a collision.
179                uint occupancy = collisionGridOccupancy[index];
180                for (uint i=0; i<occupancy; i++)
181                {
182                    Shape * shapeToCheck = collisionGrid[index][i];
183                    if (shapeToCheck->intersects(s))
184                    {
185                        Print::printf(Print::VERBOSE_DEBUG, "Found another object intersecting.");
186                        return false;
187                    }
188                }
189            }
190        }
191    }
192
193    // We need to add the shape to each grid volume that this shape's bounding box intersects with.
194    for (uint z=zMin; z<=zMax; z++)
195    {
196        for (uint y=yMin; y<=yMax; y++)
197        {
198            uint index=xMin+(y*collisionGridXSize)+(z*collisionGridXSize*collisionGridYSize);
199            for (uint x=xMin; x<=xMax; x++, index++)
200            {
201                // If there is no room in the list, increase its size.
202                if (collisionGridOccupancy[index] >= collisionGridSize[index])
203                {
204                    uint currentSize = collisionGridSize[index];
205                    Shape ** newList = new Shape*[currentSize*2];
206                    memcpy(newList, collisionGrid[index], sizeof(Shape*)*currentSize);
207                    collisionGridSize[index]=currentSize*2;
208                    delete [] collisionGrid[index];
209                    collisionGrid[index] = newList;
210                }
211
212                // Add the new shape to the list.
213                int i=collisionGridOccupancy[index]++;
214                collisionGrid[index][i] = s;
215            }
216        }
217    }
218
219    // Add the shape to the list of unique objects.
220    objects.push_back(s);
221
222    return true;
223}
224
225void LatticeBuilder::removeObject(Shape * s)
226{
227	// Add all of the obstacles.
228    for (std::vector<Shape *>::iterator it=objects.begin(); it<objects.end(); it++)
229    {
230        Shape * shape = *it;
231        if (s->getShapeType() == Shape::SPHERE && shape->getShapeType() == Shape::SPHERE)
232        {
233        	Sphere * target = (Sphere *)s;
234            Sphere * sphere = (Sphere *)shape;
235            if (target->getType() == sphere->getType() && target->getCenter().x == sphere->getCenter().x && target->getCenter().y == sphere->getCenter().y && target->getCenter().z == sphere->getCenter().z && target->getRadius() == sphere->getRadius())
236            {
237            	objects.erase(it);
238            	return;
239            }
240        }
241        else
242        {
243            throw Exception("Unsupported shape type.");
244        }
245    }
246}
247
248bool LatticeBuilder::placeSphere(point center, si_dist_t radius, site_t type)
249{
250	Sphere * s = new Sphere(center,radius,type);
251	return placeObject(s);
252}
253
254void LatticeBuilder::removeSphere(point center, si_dist_t radius, site_t type)
255{
256	Sphere * s = new Sphere(center,radius,type);
257	removeObject(s);
258	delete s;
259}
260
261uint LatticeBuilder::placeRandomSphere(si_dist_t radius, site_t type, site_t region)
262{
263    uint numberAttempts=0;
264    double randomValues[3];
265    Sphere * s = new Sphere(0.0,radius,type);
266
267    // Get the bounding box for this region.
268    bounding_box b = regionBounds[region];
269
270    // Randomly place the sphere until we find a location for it.
271    while (true)
272    {
273        // Get a random location in the region's bounding box.
274        numberAttempts++;
275        rng->getRandomDoubles(randomValues, 3);
276        point center(b.min.x+(((si_dist_t)randomValues[0])*(b.max.x-b.min.x)), b.min.y+(((si_dist_t)randomValues[1])*(b.max.y-b.min.y)), b.min.z+(((si_dist_t)randomValues[2])*(b.max.z-b.min.z)));
277        s->setCenter(center);
278
279        // Make sure the sphere is within one of the region's shapes.
280        for (std::vector<Shape *>::iterator it=regionShapes[region].begin(); it<regionShapes[region].end(); it++)
281        {
282            if ((*it)->contains(s))
283            {
284            	// Make sure the object does not overlap with regions with a higher type value.
285            	bool overlaps = false;
286            	for (uint i=0; i<definedRegions.size() && overlaps == false; i++)
287            	{
288            		if (definedRegions[i] > region)
289            		{
290            			for (std::vector<Shape *>::iterator it2=regionShapes[definedRegions[i]].begin(); it2<regionShapes[definedRegions[i]].end(); it2++)
291            			{
292            				if ((*it2)->contains(s)) // TODO: this needs to be changes to intersects() after those methods are all implemented.
293            				{
294            					overlaps = true;
295            					break;
296            				}
297            			}
298            		}
299            	}
300
301                //  If it didn't overlap, try to place the object.
302                if (!overlaps && placeObject(s))
303                {
304					Print::printf(Print::VERBOSE_DEBUG, "Placed sphere in region %d in %d attempts",region,numberAttempts);
305					return numberAttempts;
306                }
307            }
308        }
309    }
310}
311
312void LatticeBuilder::placeRandomSpheres(uint count, si_dist_t radius, site_t type, site_t region)
313{
314    uint totalAttempts=0;
315    for (uint i=0; i<count; i++)
316    {
317        totalAttempts+=placeRandomSphere(radius, type, region);
318    }
319    Print::printf(Print::DEBUG, "Placed %d spheres of type %d in region %d in %d total attempts",count,type,region,totalAttempts);
320}
321
322void LatticeBuilder::fillWithRandomSpheres(double volumeFraction, si_dist_t radius, site_t type, site_t region)
323{
324    double totalVolume = 0.0;
325    std::vector<Shape *> shapes = regionShapes[region];
326    for (std::vector<Shape *>::iterator it = shapes.begin(); it != shapes.end(); it++)
327    {
328        Shape * shape = *it;
329        totalVolume += shape->getVolume();
330    }
331
332    uint numberSpheres = floor((totalVolume*volumeFraction)/((4.0/3.0)*PI*radius*radius*radius));
333    Print::printf(Print::DEBUG, "Placing %d spheres of radius %0.2e in volume of %e m^3", numberSpheres, radius, totalVolume);
334    placeRandomSpheres(numberSpheres, radius, type, region);
335
336    if (Print::ifPrinted(9))  {
337       uint totalGridObjects = 0;
338       for (uint i=0; i<collisionGridXSize*collisionGridYSize*collisionGridZSize; i++)
339	   totalGridObjects += collisionGridOccupancy[i];
340       Print::printf(Print::DEBUG, "Number of grid volumes was %d with an mean of %0.2f objects each",collisionGridXSize*collisionGridYSize*collisionGridZSize,((double)totalGridObjects)/((double)collisionGridXSize*collisionGridYSize*collisionGridZSize));
341    }
342}
343
344void LatticeBuilder::getSpatialModel(SpatialModel * spatialModel)
345{
346	spatialModel->Clear();
347
348	// Set all of the regions.
349	for (std::map<site_t,std::vector<Shape *> >::iterator it = regionShapes.begin(); it != regionShapes.end(); it++)
350	{
351		std::vector<Shape *> shapes = it->second;
352		for (std::vector<Shape *>::iterator it2 = shapes.begin(); it2 != shapes.end(); it2++)
353		{
354			Shape * shape = *it2;
355			spatialModel->add_region();
356			uint i = spatialModel->region_size()-1;
357			if (shape->getShapeType() == Shape::SPHERE) 
358            {
359				Sphere *sphere = (Sphere *)shape;
360				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_shape(sphere->getShapeType());
361				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_site_type(sphere->getType());
362				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(sphere->getCenter().x);
363				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(sphere->getCenter().y);
364				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(sphere->getCenter().z);
365				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(sphere->getRadius());;
366            }
367            else if (shape->getShapeType() == Shape::HEMISPHERE)
368            {
369                Hemisphere * hemisphere = (Hemisphere *)shape;
370                spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_shape(hemisphere->getShapeType());
371                spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_site_type(hemisphere->getType());
372                spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(hemisphere->getCenter().x);
373                spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(hemisphere->getCenter().y);
374                spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(hemisphere->getCenter().z);
375                spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(hemisphere->getOrientation().x);
376                spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(hemisphere->getOrientation().y);
377                spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(hemisphere->getOrientation().z);
378                spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(hemisphere->getRadius());
379            }
380			else if (shape->getShapeType() == Shape::CAPSULE)
381			{
382				Capsule * capsule = (Capsule *)shape;
383				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_shape(capsule->getShapeType());
384				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_site_type(capsule->getType());
385				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(capsule->getP1().x);
386				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(capsule->getP1().y);
387				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(capsule->getP1().z);
388				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(capsule->getP2().x);
389				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(capsule->getP2().y);
390				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(capsule->getP2().z);
391				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(capsule->getRadius());
392			}
393			else if (shape->getShapeType() == Shape::CAPSULE_SHELL)
394			{
395				CapsuleShell * capsuleShell = (CapsuleShell *)shape;
396				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_shape(capsuleShell->getShapeType());
397				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_site_type(capsuleShell->getType());
398				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(capsuleShell->getP1().x);
399				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(capsuleShell->getP1().y);
400				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(capsuleShell->getP1().z);
401				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(capsuleShell->getP2().x);
402				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(capsuleShell->getP2().y);
403				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(capsuleShell->getP2().z);
404				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(capsuleShell->getOuterRadius());
405				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(capsuleShell->getInnerRadius());
406			}
407			else if (shape->getShapeType() == Shape::CUBOID)
408			{
409				Cuboid * cuboid = (Cuboid *)shape;
410				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_shape(cuboid->getShapeType());
411				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_site_type(cuboid->getType());
412				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP1().x);
413				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP1().y);
414				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP1().z);
415				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP2().x);
416				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP2().y);
417				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP2().z);
418			}
419			else if (shape->getShapeType() == Shape::UNION)
420			{
421				Union * uni = (Union *)shape;
422				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_shape(uni->getShapeType());
423				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_site_type(uni->getType());
424                // TODO: add union shape parameters
425                /*
426				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP1().x);
427				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP1().y);
428				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP1().z);
429				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP2().x);
430				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP2().y);
431				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP2().z);
432                 */
433			}
434			else if (shape->getShapeType() == Shape::UNIONSET)
435			{
436				UnionSet * uni = (UnionSet *)shape;
437				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_shape(uni->getShapeType());
438				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_site_type(uni->getType());
439                // TODO: add union shape parameters
440                /*
441				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP1().x);
442				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP1().y);
443				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP1().z);
444				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP2().x);
445				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP2().y);
446				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP2().z);
447                 */
448			}
449            else if (shape->getShapeType() == Shape::INTERSECTION)
450			{
451				Intersection * interObj = (Intersection *)shape;
452				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_shape(interObj->getShapeType());
453				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_site_type(interObj->getType());
454                // TODO: add intersection shape parameters
455                /*
456				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP1().x);
457				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP1().y);
458				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP1().z);
459				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP2().x);
460				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP2().y);
461				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cuboid->getP2().z);
462                */
463			}
464            else if (shape->getShapeType() == Shape::DIFFERENCE)
465			{
466				Difference * diffObj = (Difference *)shape;
467				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_shape(diffObj->getShapeType());
468				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_site_type(diffObj->getType());
469                // TODO: add difference shape parameters
470                /*
471				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP1().x);
472				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP1().y);
473				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP1().z);
474				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP2().x);
475				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP2().y);
476				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP2().z);
477                 */
478			}
479            else if (shape->getShapeType() == Shape::TORUS)
480			{
481				Torus * torObj = (Torus *)shape;
482				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_shape(torObj->getShapeType());
483				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_site_type(torObj->getType());
484                // TODO: add difference shape parameters
485                /*
486                 spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP1().x);
487                 spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP1().y);
488                 spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP1().z);
489                 spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP2().x);
490                 spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP2().y);
491                 spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP2().z);
492                 */
493			}
494            else if (shape->getShapeType() == Shape::ELLIPSE)
495			{
496				Ellipse * ellObj = (Ellipse *)shape;
497				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_shape(ellObj->getShapeType());
498				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_site_type(ellObj->getType());
499                // TODO: add difference shape parameters
500                /*
501                 spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP1().x);
502                 spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP1().y);
503                 spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP1().z);
504                 spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP2().x);
505                 spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP2().y);
506                 spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(diffObj->getP2().z);
507                 */
508			}
509            else if (shape->getShapeType() == Shape::CYLINDER)
510			{
511				Cylinder * cylObj = (Cylinder *)shape;
512				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_shape(cylObj->getShapeType());
513				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_site_type(cylObj->getType());
514				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cylObj->getP1().x);
515				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cylObj->getP1().y);
516				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cylObj->getP1().z);
517				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cylObj->getP2().x);
518				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cylObj->getP2().y);
519				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cylObj->getP2().z);
520				spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(cylObj->getRadius());
521			}
522            else if (shape->getShapeType() == Shape::CONE)
523            {
524                Cone * coneObj = (Cone *)shape;
525                spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_shape(coneObj->getShapeType());
526                spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->set_site_type(coneObj->getType());
527                spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(coneObj->getCenter().x);
528                spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(coneObj->getCenter().y);
529                spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(coneObj->getCenter().z);
530                spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(coneObj->getRadius());
531                spatialModel->mutable_region(i)->add_shape_parameter(coneObj->getHeight());
532            }
533			else
534			{
535				throw Exception("Unsupported shape type.");
536			}
537		}
538	}
539
540	// Add all of the obstacles.
541    for (std::vector<Shape *>::iterator it=objects.begin(); it<objects.end(); it++)
542    {
543        Shape * shape = *it;
544        spatialModel->add_obstacle();
545        uint i = spatialModel->obstacle_size()-1;
546        if (shape->getShapeType() == Shape::SPHERE)
547        {
548            Sphere * sphere = (Sphere *)shape;
549            spatialModel->mutable_obstacle(i)->set_shape(sphere->getShapeType());
550            spatialModel->mutable_obstacle(i)->set_site_type(sphere->getType());
551            spatialModel->mutable_obstacle(i)->add_shape_parameter(sphere->getCenter().x);
552            spatialModel->mutable_obstacle(i)->add_shape_parameter(sphere->getCenter().y);
553            spatialModel->mutable_obstacle(i)->add_shape_parameter(sphere->getCenter().z);
554            spatialModel->mutable_obstacle(i)->add_shape_parameter(sphere->getRadius());
555        }
556        else
557        {
558            throw Exception("Unsupported shape type.");
559        }
560    }
561}
562
563void LatticeBuilder::addParticles(particle_t particleType, site_t siteType, uint count)
564{
565	particles.push_back(ParticlePlacement(particleType, siteType, count));
566}
567
568void LatticeBuilder::discretizeTo(lm::rdme::Lattice * lattice, site_t obstacleSiteType, double fractionObstacleSitesOccupied)
569{
570	// Go through each region and discretize it to the lattice.
571	for (uint i=0; i<definedRegions.size(); i++)
572	{
573		site_t region = definedRegions[i];
574
575		// Go through each shape making up the region.
576		for (std::vector<Shape *>::iterator it=regionShapes[region].begin(); it<regionShapes[region].end(); it++)
577		{
578			Shape * shape = *it;
579			shape->discretizeTo(lattice);
580		}
581	}
582
583	// Add the obstacles.
584	this->discretizeObstaclesTo(lattice, obstacleSiteType, fractionObstacleSitesOccupied);
585
586	// Add all of the particles to the lattice.
587	for (uint i=0; i<particles.size(); i++)
588	{
589		ParticlePlacement p = particles[i];
590		uint numberAttempts=0;
591		uint placed=0;
592		while (placed < p.count)
593		{
594			numberAttempts++;
595			double randomValues[3];
596			rng->getRandomDoubles(randomValues, 3);
597			lattice_size_t x = (uint)floor(randomValues[0]*(double)lattice->getXSize());
598			if (x == lattice->getXSize()) x--;
599			lattice_size_t y = (uint)floor(randomValues[1]*(double)lattice->getYSize());
600			if (y == lattice->getYSize()) y--;
601			lattice_size_t z = (uint)floor(randomValues[2]*(double)lattice->getZSize());
602			if (z == lattice->getZSize()) z--;
603			if (lattice->getSiteType(x, y, z) == p.siteType && lattice->getOccupancy(x,y,z) < lattice->getMaxOccupancy())
604			{
605				lattice->addParticle(x, y, z, p.particleType+1);
606				placed++;
607			}
608		}
609		Print::printf(Print::DEBUG, "Placed %d particles of type %d in sites of type %d in %d attempts",p.count,p.particleType,p.siteType,numberAttempts);
610	}
611}
612
613void LatticeBuilder::discretizeObstaclesTo(lm::rdme::Lattice * lattice, site_t obstacleSiteType, double fractionObstacleSitesOccupied)
614{
615	// Track the occupied volume of each subvolume.
616	double * occupiedVolume = new double[lattice->getNumberSites()];
617	for (uint i=0; i<lattice->getNumberSites(); i++) occupiedVolume[i] = 0.0;
618
619	// Go through each obstacle and assign its volume to the appropriate subvolume.
620    for (std::vector<Shape *>::iterator it=objects.begin(); it<objects.end(); it++)
621    {
622        Shape * shape = *it;
623        if (shape->getShapeType() == Shape::SPHERE)
624        {
625            Sphere * sphere = (Sphere *)shape;
626
627            // If the sphere is much bigger than the subvolume size, occupy all of the sites with which the sphere overlaps.
628            if (sphere->getRadius() > lattice->getSpacing())
629            {
630            	point c=sphere->getCenter();
631            	si_dist_t r=sphere->getRadius();
632            	si_dist_t siteSubvolume = lattice->getSpacing()*lattice->getSpacing()*lattice->getSpacing();
633
634        		// Get the bounds of the circle.
635        		lattice_size_t x1 = (lattice_size_t)floor((c.x-r)/lattice->getSpacing());
636        		lattice_size_t x2 = ((lattice_size_t)floor((c.x+r)/lattice->getSpacing()))+1;
637        		lattice_size_t y1 = (lattice_size_t)floor((c.y-r)/lattice->getSpacing());
638        		lattice_size_t y2 = ((lattice_size_t)floor((c.y+r)/lattice->getSpacing()))+1;
639        		lattice_size_t z1 = (lattice_size_t)floor((c.z-r)/lattice->getSpacing());
640        		lattice_size_t z2 = ((lattice_size_t)floor((c.z+r)/lattice->getSpacing()))+1;
641
642        		// Fill in the circle.
643        		for (lattice_size_t x = x1; x<=x2; x++)
644        			for (lattice_size_t y = y1; y<=y2; y++)
645            			for (lattice_size_t z = z1; z<=z2; z++)
646						{
647							point lc((((double)x)+0.5)*lattice->getSpacing()-c.x, (((double)y)+0.5)*lattice->getSpacing()-c.y, (((double)z)+0.5)*lattice->getSpacing()-c.z);
648							if (lc.x*lc.x+lc.y*lc.y+lc.z*lc.z < r*r)
649								occupiedVolume[x*lattice->getYSize()*lattice->getZSize() + y*lattice->getZSize() + z] += siteSubvolume;
650						}
651            }
652
653            // Otherwise, the sphere is on the order of the subvolume size, try to distribute its volume to nearby subvolumes.
654            else
655            {
656				// Figure out which half lattice site the subvolume is nearest to.
657				uint hx = lround(sphere->getCenter().x/(lattice->getSpacing()/2));
658				uint hy = lround(sphere->getCenter().y/(lattice->getSpacing()/2));
659				uint hz = lround(sphere->getCenter().z/(lattice->getSpacing()/2));
660
661				uint xsv[2];
662				uint ysv[2];
663				uint zsv[2];
664
665				// Figure out which subvolumes to assign the density.
666				if (hx%2 == 1)
667				{
668					// x falls in the center of a subvolume.
669					xsv[0] = hx/2;
670					xsv[1] = xsv[0];
671				}
672				else
673				{
674					// x falls on the edge of two subvolumes.
675					xsv[0] = hx/2;
676					xsv[1] = xsv[0]-1;
677				}
678				if (hy%2 == 1)
679				{
680					// y falls in the center of a subvolume.
681					ysv[0] = hy/2;
682					ysv[1] = ysv[0];
683				}
684				else
685				{
686					// y falls on the edge of two subvolumes.
687					ysv[0] = hy/2;
688					ysv[1] = ysv[0]-1;
689				}
690				if (hz%2 == 1)
691				{
692					// z falls in the center of a subvolume.
693					zsv[0] = hz/2;
694					zsv[1] = zsv[0];
695				}
696				else
697				{
698					// z falls on the edge of two subvolumes.
699					zsv[0] = hz/2;
700					zsv[1] = zsv[0]-1;
701				}
702
703				// Puts the density in the subvolumes.
704				double eighthVolume = sphere->getVolume()/8;
705				for (uint i=0; i<2; i++)
706					for (uint j=0; j<2; j++)
707						for (uint k=0; k<2; k++)
708						{
709							occupiedVolume[xsv[i]*lattice->getYSize()*lattice->getZSize() + ysv[j]*lattice->getZSize() + zsv[k]] += eighthVolume;
710						}
711            }
712        }
713        else
714        {
715            throw Exception("Unsupported shape type.");
716        }
717    }
718
719    // Create a sorted list of all of the occupancy values.
720    std::list<double> occupancyValues;
721    for (uint x=0, index=0; x<lattice->getXSize(); x++)
722    	for (uint y=0; y<lattice->getYSize(); y++)
723    		for (uint z=0; z<lattice->getZSize(); z++, index++)
724    			if (occupiedVolume[index] > 0.0)
725    				occupancyValues.push_back(occupiedVolume[index]);
726    occupancyValues.sort();
727    occupancyValues.reverse();
728
729    // Get the occupancy cutoff.
730    uint maxOccupiedSites = lround(fractionObstacleSitesOccupied*((double)lattice->getNumberSites()));
731    double cutoff = 0.0;
732    uint i=0;
733    for (std::list<double>::iterator it = occupancyValues.begin(); it != occupancyValues.end(); it++, i++)
734    {
735    	double occupancy = *it;
736    	if (i >= maxOccupiedSites)
737    	{
738    		cutoff = occupancy;
739    		break;
740    	}
741    }
742
743    // Go through the subvolumes and mark any subvolumes that are over the threshold as occupied.
744    uint numberOccupiedSites=0;
745    for (uint x=0, index=0; x<lattice->getXSize(); x++)
746    	for (uint y=0; y<lattice->getYSize(); y++)
747    		for (uint z=0; z<lattice->getZSize(); z++, index++)
748    		{
749    			if (occupiedVolume[index] > 0.0 && occupiedVolume[index] >= cutoff)
750    			{
751    				lattice->setSiteType(x, y, z, obstacleSiteType);
752    				numberOccupiedSites++;
753    			}
754    		}
755
756    // Free the resources.
757    delete [] occupiedVolume;
758
759    Print::printf(Print::DEBUG, "Marked %d sites as occupied by obstacles",numberOccupiedSites);
760}
761
762}
763}

Threading Classes#

WorkerManager.h#

 1/*
 2 * University of Illinois Open Source License
 3 * Copyright 2011-2018 Luthey-Schulten Group,
 4 * All rights reserved.
 5 * 
 6 * Developed by: Luthey-Schulten Group
 7 * 			     University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
 8 * 			     http://www.scs.uiuc.edu/~schulten
 9 * 
10 * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of
11 * this software and associated documentation files (the Software), to deal with 
12 * the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to 
13 * use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies 
14 * of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to 
15 * do so, subject to the following conditions:
16 * 
17 * - Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, 
18 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers.
19 * 
20 * - Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, 
21 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers in the documentation 
22 * and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
23 * 
24 * - Neither the names of the Luthey-Schulten Group, University of Illinois at
25 * Urbana-Champaign, nor the names of its contributors may be used to endorse or
26 * promote products derived from this Software without specific prior written
27 * permission.
28 * 
29 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR 
30 * IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, 
31 * FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT.  IN NO EVENT SHALL 
32 * THE CONTRIBUTORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR 
33 * OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, 
34 * ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR 
35 * OTHER DEALINGS WITH THE SOFTWARE.
36 *
37 * Author(s): Elijah Roberts
38 */
39
40#ifndef LM_THREAD_WORKER_MANAGER_H_
41#define LM_THREAD_WORKER_MANAGER_H_
42
43#include <list>
44#include "thread/Thread.h"
45#include "thread/Worker.h"
46
47using std::list;
48
49namespace lm {
50namespace thread {
51
52/// @class WorkerManager
53/// @brief A singleton manager that creates and manages workers that run on a processing node
54class WorkerManager
55{
56public:
57    /// @brief Get the global worker manager
58    /// @return globalWorkerManager Global thread manager instance handle
59    static WorkerManager * getInstance();
60
61private:
62    static WorkerManager instance;  // Global thread manager
63
64public:
65    /// @brief Create the WorkerManager
66    WorkerManager();
67    /// @brief Destroy the WorkerManager
68    ~WorkerManager();
69
70    /// @brief Adds a worker to the manager
71    /// @param worker Worker to add
72    void addWorker(Worker * worker);
73    /// @brief Removes a worker from the manager
74    /// @param worker Worker handle for which to remove
75    void removeWorker(Worker * worker);
76    /// @brief Aborts all the worker threads
77    void abortWorkers();
78    /// @brief Causes all the worker threads to checkpoint (checkpointing is currently unimplemented)
79    void checkpointWorkers();
80    /// @brief Stops all the worker threads (e.g. merges them with the master)
81    void stopWorkers();
82
83private:
84    pthread_mutex_t mutex;      // Main mutex for performing thread operations
85    list<Worker *> workers;     // List of all workers
86};
87
88}
89}
90
91
92#endif

WorkerManager.cpp#

  1/*
  2 * University of Illinois Open Source License
  3 * Copyright 2011-2018 Luthey-Schulten Group,
  4 * All rights reserved.
  5 * 
  6 * Developed by: Luthey-Schulten Group
  7 * 			     University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
  8 * 			     http://www.scs.uiuc.edu/~schulten
  9 * 
 10 * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of
 11 * this software and associated documentation files (the Software), to deal with 
 12 * the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to 
 13 * use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies 
 14 * of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to 
 15 * do so, subject to the following conditions:
 16 * 
 17 * - Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, 
 18 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers.
 19 * 
 20 * - Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, 
 21 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers in the documentation 
 22 * and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
 23 * 
 24 * - Neither the names of the Luthey-Schulten Group, University of Illinois at
 25 * Urbana-Champaign, nor the names of its contributors may be used to endorse or
 26 * promote products derived from this Software without specific prior written
 27 * permission.
 28 * 
 29 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR 
 30 * IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, 
 31 * FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT.  IN NO EVENT SHALL 
 32 * THE CONTRIBUTORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR 
 33 * OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, 
 34 * ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR 
 35 * OTHER DEALINGS WITH THE SOFTWARE.
 36 *
 37 * Author(s): Elijah Roberts
 38 */
 39
 40#include <list>
 41#include "config.h"
 42#include "core/Print.h"
 43#include "thread/Thread.h"
 44#include "thread/Worker.h"
 45#include "thread/WorkerManager.h"
 46
 47namespace lm {
 48namespace thread {
 49
 50WorkerManager WorkerManager::instance;
 51
 52WorkerManager * WorkerManager::getInstance()
 53{
 54    return &instance;
 55}
 56
 57WorkerManager::WorkerManager()
 58{
 59    // Create the mutex.
 60    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_init(&mutex, NULL));
 61}
 62
 63WorkerManager::~WorkerManager()
 64{
 65    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK_NOTHROW(pthread_mutex_destroy(&mutex));
 66}
 67
 68void WorkerManager::addWorker(Worker * worker)
 69{
 70    //// BEGIN CRITICAL SECTION: mutex
 71    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_lock(&mutex));
 72    workers.push_back(worker);
 73    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_unlock(&mutex));
 74    //// END CRITICAL SECTION: mutex
 75}
 76
 77void WorkerManager::removeWorker(Worker * worker)
 78{
 79    //// BEGIN CRITICAL SECTION: mutex
 80    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_lock(&mutex));
 81    workers.remove(worker);
 82    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_unlock(&mutex));
 83    //// END CRITICAL SECTION: mutex
 84}
 85
 86void WorkerManager::abortWorkers()
 87{
 88    //// BEGIN CRITICAL SECTION: mutex
 89    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_lock(&mutex));
 90
 91    // Abort the worker threads.
 92    for (list<Worker *>::iterator it=workers.begin(); it != workers.end(); it++)
 93    {
 94        (*it)->abort();
 95    }
 96
 97    // Wait for the worker threads to stop.
 98    for (list<Worker *>::iterator it=workers.begin(); it != workers.end(); it++)
 99    {
100        (*it)->stop();
101    }
102
103    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_unlock(&mutex));
104    //// END CRITICAL SECTION: mutex
105}
106
107void WorkerManager::checkpointWorkers()
108{
109    //// BEGIN CRITICAL SECTION: mutex
110    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_lock(&mutex));
111
112    // Tell the worker threads to checkpoint.
113    for (list<Worker *>::iterator it=workers.begin(); it != workers.end(); it++)
114    {
115        (*it)->checkpoint();
116    }
117
118    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_unlock(&mutex));
119    //// END CRITICAL SECTION: mutex
120}
121
122void WorkerManager::stopWorkers()
123{
124    //// BEGIN CRITICAL SECTION: mutex
125    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_lock(&mutex));
126
127    // Wait for the worker threads to stop.
128    for (list<Worker *>::iterator it=workers.begin(); it != workers.end(); it++)
129    {
130        Print::printf(Print::DEBUG, "Stopping worker thread: %u", (*it)->getId());
131        (*it)->stop();
132        Print::printf(Print::DEBUG, "Stopped worker thread: %u", (*it)->getId());
133    }
134
135    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_unlock(&mutex));
136    //// END CRITICAL SECTION: mutex
137}
138
139}
140}

Worker.h#

 1/*
 2 * University of Illinois Open Source License
 3 * Copyright 2008-2018 Luthey-Schulten Group,
 4 * All rights reserved.
 5 * 
 6 * Developed by: Luthey-Schulten Group
 7 * 			     University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
 8 * 			     http://www.scs.uiuc.edu/~schulten
 9 * 
10 * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of
11 * this software and associated documentation files (the Software), to deal with 
12 * the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to 
13 * use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies 
14 * of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to 
15 * do so, subject to the following conditions:
16 * 
17 * - Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, 
18 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers.
19 * 
20 * - Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, 
21 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers in the documentation 
22 * and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
23 * 
24 * - Neither the names of the Luthey-Schulten Group, University of Illinois at
25 * Urbana-Champaign, nor the names of its contributors may be used to endorse or
26 * promote products derived from this Software without specific prior written
27 * permission.
28 * 
29 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR 
30 * IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, 
31 * FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT.  IN NO EVENT SHALL 
32 * THE CONTRIBUTORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR 
33 * OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, 
34 * ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR 
35 * OTHER DEALINGS WITH THE SOFTWARE.
36 *
37 * Author(s): Elijah Roberts
38 */
39
40#ifndef LM_THREAD_WORKER_H_
41#define LM_THREAD_WORKER_H_
42
43#include "thread/Thread.h"
44
45namespace lm {
46namespace thread {
47
48/// @class Worker
49/// @brief An actual worker Thread that runs a simulation replicate
50class Worker : public Thread
51{
52public:
53    /// @brief Creates thread and attaches it to the manager
54    Worker();
55    /// @brief Removes thread from manager and deletes thread
56    virtual ~Worker();
57    
58    /// @brief Set the aborted status for a thread and wakes thread
59    virtual void abort();
60    /// @brief Checkpoint (currently unimplemented)
61    virtual void checkpoint();
62
63protected:
64    volatile bool aborted;  // Status to indicate the replicate was aborted
65};
66
67}
68}
69
70#endif

Worker.cpp#

 1/*
 2 * University of Illinois Open Source License
 3 * Copyright 2008-2018 Luthey-Schulten Group,
 4 * All rights reserved.
 5 * 
 6 * Developed by: Luthey-Schulten Group
 7 * 			     University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
 8 * 			     http://www.scs.uiuc.edu/~schulten
 9 * 
10 * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of
11 * this software and associated documentation files (the Software), to deal with 
12 * the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to 
13 * use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies 
14 * of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to 
15 * do so, subject to the following conditions:
16 * 
17 * - Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, 
18 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers.
19 * 
20 * - Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, 
21 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers in the documentation 
22 * and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
23 * 
24 * - Neither the names of the Luthey-Schulten Group, University of Illinois at
25 * Urbana-Champaign, nor the names of its contributors may be used to endorse or
26 * promote products derived from this Software without specific prior written
27 * permission.
28 * 
29 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR 
30 * IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, 
31 * FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT.  IN NO EVENT SHALL 
32 * THE CONTRIBUTORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR 
33 * OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, 
34 * ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR 
35 * OTHER DEALINGS WITH THE SOFTWARE.
36 *
37 * Author(s): Elijah Roberts
38 */
39
40#include "config.h"
41#include "thread/Thread.h"
42#include "thread/Worker.h"
43#include "thread/WorkerManager.h"
44
45namespace lm {
46namespace thread {
47
48Worker::Worker()
49:aborted(false)
50{
51    WorkerManager::getInstance()->addWorker(this);
52}
53
54Worker::~Worker()
55{
56    WorkerManager::getInstance()->removeWorker(this);
57}
58
59void Worker::abort()
60{
61    //// BEGIN CRITICAL SECTION: controlMutex
62    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_lock(&controlMutex));
63    if (running)
64    {
65        // Mark that the worker should abort.
66        aborted = true;
67    }
68    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_unlock(&controlMutex));
69    //// END CRITICAL SECTION: controlMutex
70
71    // Wake the thread.
72    wake();
73}
74
75void Worker::checkpoint(){}
76
77}
78}

Thread.h#

  1/*
  2 * University of Illinois Open Source License
  3 * Copyright 2008-2018 Luthey-Schulten Group,
  4 * All rights reserved.
  5 * 
  6 * Developed by: Luthey-Schulten Group
  7 * 			     University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
  8 * 			     http://www.scs.uiuc.edu/~schulten
  9 * 
 10 * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of
 11 * this software and associated documentation files (the Software), to deal with 
 12 * the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to 
 13 * use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies 
 14 * of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to 
 15 * do so, subject to the following conditions:
 16 * 
 17 * - Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, 
 18 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers.
 19 * 
 20 * - Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, 
 21 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers in the documentation 
 22 * and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
 23 * 
 24 * - Neither the names of the Luthey-Schulten Group, University of Illinois at
 25 * Urbana-Champaign, nor the names of its contributors may be used to endorse or
 26 * promote products derived from this Software without specific prior written
 27 * permission.
 28 * 
 29 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR 
 30 * IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, 
 31 * FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT.  IN NO EVENT SHALL 
 32 * THE CONTRIBUTORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR 
 33 * OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, 
 34 * ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR 
 35 * OTHER DEALINGS WITH THE SOFTWARE.
 36 *
 37 * Author(s): Elijah Roberts
 38 */
 39
 40#ifndef LM_THREAD_THREAD_H_
 41#define LM_THREAD_THREAD_H_
 42
 43#include <cstdlib>
 44#include <pthread.h>
 45#include "core/Exceptions.h"
 46
 47namespace lm {
 48namespace thread {
 49
 50/// @class PthreadException
 51/// @brief An Exception class for handling pthread exceptions.
 52class PthreadException : public Exception
 53{
 54public:
 55    PthreadException(int error, const char * file, const int line) : Exception("Error in pthread library", error, file, line) {}
 56};
 57
 58/// @class Thread
 59/// @brief A base class wrapping pthreads.
 60class Thread
 61{
 62public:
 63    /// @brief Creates a pthread locking mechanism and initializes "Thread"
 64    Thread();
 65    /// @brief Destory the Thread
 66    virtual ~Thread();
 67    
 68    /// @brief If no thread exists, creates a new thread and begins execution
 69    virtual void start();
 70    /// @brief Joins the thread with the parent waiting if necessary
 71    virtual void stop();
 72    /// @brief Wakes a sleeping thead
 73    virtual void wake()=0;
 74    /// @brief Returns the pthread based id for the Thread
 75    /// @return pthread assigned id
 76    virtual pthread_t getId() {return threadId;}
 77    /// @brief Binds the thread to a CPU core
 78    /// @param The cpu core for which to bind the thread
 79    virtual void setAffinity(int cpuNumber);
 80
 81protected:
 82    virtual int run()=0;
 83
 84private:
 85    static void * start_thread(void * obj);
 86
 87protected:
 88    pthread_mutex_t controlMutex;   // thread locking mechanism
 89    pthread_t threadId;             // thread ID
 90    volatile bool running;          // thread status
 91    int cpuNumber;                  // which cpu thread is running on
 92};
 93
 94}
 95}
 96
 97
 98/// @def PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK
 99/// @brief Exception wrapping for the pthread api.
100#define PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_call) {int _pthread_ret_=pthread_call; if (_pthread_ret_ != 0) throw lm::thread::PthreadException(_pthread_ret_,__FILE__,__LINE__);}
101#define PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK_NOTHROW(pthread_call) {int _pthread_ret_=pthread_call; if (_pthread_ret_ != 0) {fprintf(stderr, "%s:%d: Pthread error, returned %d\n", __FILE__, __LINE__, _pthread_ret_); abort();}}
102
103#endif

Thread.cpp#

  1/*
  2 * University of Illinois Open Source License
  3 * Copyright 2008-2018 Luthey-Schulten Group,
  4 * All rights reserved.
  5 * 
  6 * Developed by: Luthey-Schulten Group
  7 * 			     University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
  8 * 			     http://www.scs.uiuc.edu/~schulten
  9 * 
 10 * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of
 11 * this software and associated documentation files (the Software), to deal with 
 12 * the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to 
 13 * use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies 
 14 * of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to 
 15 * do so, subject to the following conditions:
 16 * 
 17 * - Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, 
 18 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers.
 19 * 
 20 * - Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, 
 21 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers in the documentation 
 22 * and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
 23 * 
 24 * - Neither the names of the Luthey-Schulten Group, University of Illinois at
 25 * Urbana-Champaign, nor the names of its contributors may be used to endorse or
 26 * promote products derived from this Software without specific prior written
 27 * permission.
 28 * 
 29 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR 
 30 * IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, 
 31 * FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT.  IN NO EVENT SHALL 
 32 * THE CONTRIBUTORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR 
 33 * OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, 
 34 * ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR 
 35 * OTHER DEALINGS WITH THE SOFTWARE.
 36 *
 37 * Author(s): Elijah Roberts
 38 */
 39
 40#include "config.h"
 41#include <pthread.h>
 42#include "core/Print.h"
 43#include "thread/Thread.h"
 44
 45namespace lm {
 46namespace thread {
 47
 48Thread::Thread()
 49:threadId(0),running(false),cpuNumber(-1)
 50{
 51    // Create the control mutex.
 52	pthread_mutexattr_t attr;
 53	PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutexattr_init(&attr));
 54	PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutexattr_settype(&attr, PTHREAD_MUTEX_NORMAL));
 55    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_init(&controlMutex, &attr));
 56    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutexattr_destroy(&attr));
 57}
 58
 59Thread::~Thread()
 60{
 61    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK_NOTHROW(pthread_mutex_destroy(&controlMutex));
 62}
 63
 64void Thread::setAffinity(int cpuNumber)
 65{
 66    //// BEGIN CRITICAL SECTION: controlMutex
 67    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_lock(&controlMutex));
 68
 69    // Set the assigned cpu.
 70	this->cpuNumber = cpuNumber;
 71
 72	// If we are already running, reset the processor affinity.
 73    if (running)
 74    {
 75		#if defined(LINUX) && !defined(ARM)
 76		cpu_set_t cpuset;
 77		CPU_ZERO(&cpuset);
 78		CPU_SET(cpuNumber, &cpuset);
 79		if (pthread_setaffinity_np(threadId, sizeof(cpu_set_t), &cpuset) != 0)
 80			Print::printf(Print::WARNING, "Could not bind thread %u to CPU core %d", threadId, cpuNumber);
 81		#endif
 82    }
 83    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_unlock(&controlMutex));
 84    //// END CRITICAL SECTION: controlMutex
 85}
 86
 87void Thread::start()
 88{
 89    //// BEGIN CRITICAL SECTION: controlMutex
 90    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_lock(&controlMutex));
 91    if (!running)
 92    {
 93        running=true;
 94        pthread_attr_t attr;
 95        PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_attr_init(&attr));
 96        PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&attr, PTHREAD_CREATE_JOINABLE));
 97        PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_create(&threadId, &attr, &Thread::start_thread, this));
 98        PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_attr_destroy(&attr));
 99
100    	// Set the processor affinity, if we have a cpu assigned.
101        if (cpuNumber >= 0)
102        {
103			#if defined(LINUX) && !defined(ARM)
104			cpu_set_t cpuset;
105			CPU_ZERO(&cpuset);
106			CPU_SET(cpuNumber, &cpuset);
107			if (pthread_setaffinity_np(threadId, sizeof(cpu_set_t), &cpuset) != 0)
108				Print::printf(Print::WARNING, "Could not bind thread %u to CPU core %d", threadId, cpuNumber);
109			#endif
110        }
111        Print::printf(Print::DEBUG, "Started thread %u.", threadId);
112    }
113    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_unlock(&controlMutex));
114    //// END CRITICAL SECTION: controlMutex
115}
116
117void * Thread::start_thread(void * obj)
118{
119    unsigned long long ret = (reinterpret_cast<Thread *>(obj))->run();
120    pthread_exit((void *)ret);
121}
122
123void Thread::stop()
124{
125    bool waitForThread=false;
126
127    //// BEGIN CRITICAL SECTION: controlMutex
128    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_lock(&controlMutex));
129    if (running)
130    {
131        Print::printf(Print::DEBUG, "Stopping thread %u.", threadId);
132        running = false;
133        waitForThread = true;
134    }
135    PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_mutex_unlock(&controlMutex));
136    //// END CRITICAL SECTION: controlMutex
137
138    // Wait for the thread to stop, if we really stopped it.
139    if (waitForThread)
140    {
141        // Try to wake up the thread in case it is sleeping.
142        wake();
143
144        // Join with the thread.
145        void * ret;
146        PTHREAD_EXCEPTION_CHECK(pthread_join(threadId, &ret));
147        Print::printf(Print::DEBUG, "Thread %u stopped.", threadId);
148    }
149}
150
151}
152}

Utility Classes#

SimulationFile.h#

 12 * the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to

 14 * of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to 
 15 * do so, subject to the following conditions:

 18 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers.

 20 * - Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, 
 21 * this list of conditions and the following disclaimers in the documentation 
 22 * and/or other materials provided with the distribution.

 24 * - Neither the names of the Luthey-Schulten Group, University of Illinois at
 25 * Urbana-Champaign, nor the names of its contributors may be used to endorse or
 26 * promote products derived from this Software without specific prior written
 27 * permission.

 40#ifndef LM_IO_HDF5_SIMULATIONFILE_H_
 41#define LM_IO_HDF5_SIMULATIONFILE_H_
 42
 43#include <string>
 44#include <map>
 45#include <vector>
 46#include "core/Exceptions.h"
 47#include "core/Types.h"
 48#include "io/lm_hdf5.h"
 49#include "io/ArbitraryH5.h"
 50
 51namespace lm {
 52
 53namespace rdme{
 54class Lattice;
 55class ByteLattice;
 56class IntLattice;
 57}
 58
 59namespace io {
 60
 61class DiffusionModel;
 62class ReactionModel;
 63class Lattice;
 64class ParameterValues;
 65class SpeciesCounts;
 66class SpatialModel;
 67class FirstPassageTimes;
 68
 69namespace hdf5 {
 70
 71using std::string;
 72using std::map;
 73using std::vector;
 74using lm::IOException;
 75
 76/// @class SimulationFile
 77/// @brief A representation of the simulation that is used to input or output from an HDF5 file
 78class SimulationFile
 79{
 80// Static variables and functions
 81public:
 82    static const uint MIN_VERSION;
 83    static const uint CURRENT_VERSION;
 84    static const uint MAX_REACTION_RATE_CONSTANTS;
 85    static const uint MAX_SHAPE_PARAMETERS;
 86
 87public:
 88    /// @brief Check that the HDF5 file is valid
 89    static bool isValidFile(const string filename);
 90    /// @brief Check that the HDF5 file is valid
 91    static bool isValidFile(const char * filename);
 92    /// @brief Create an HDF5 file
 93    static void create(const string filename);
 94    /// @brief Create an HDF5 file
 95    static void create(const char *  filename);
 96    /// @brief Create an HDF5 file with the specified number of species
 97    static void create(const string filename, unsigned int numberSpecies);
 98    /// @brief Create an HDF5 file with the specified number of species
 99    static void create(const char *  filename, unsigned int numberSpecies);
100    /// @brief Create an HDF5 file and initialize the model with an optional number of species
101    static void create(const char * filename, bool initializeModel, unsigned int numberSpecies=0);
102
103protected:
104    static herr_t parseParameter(hid_t location_id, const char *attr_name, const H5A_info_t *ainfo, void *op_data);
105	void writeParticleLattice_U8LE(const char* path,  uint8_t *data, unsigned int x, unsigned int y, unsigned int z, unsigned int w);
106	void writeParticleLattice_U32LE(hid_t handle, const char* path,  unsigned int *data, unsigned int x, unsigned int y, unsigned int z, unsigned int w);
107	void write3DLattice_U8LE(const char* path,  uint8_t *data, unsigned int x, unsigned int y, unsigned int z);
108    void appendToDataset(H5MetaData *header, byte *data);
109    void makeNewDataset(H5MetaData *header, byte *data);
110    void appendDsToGroup(H5MetaData *header, byte *data);
111    void readDataset(H5Lookup *req, byte *&data, size_t &sz);
112    void readAttr(H5Lookup *req, byte *&data, size_t &sz);
113    
114    
115// Non static functions and variables
116public:
117    /// @brief Create a SimulationFile with the specified filename
118    SimulationFile(const string filename);
119    /// @brief Create a SimulationFile with the specified filename
120    SimulationFile(const char* filename);
121    /// @brief Destroy the SimulationFile
122	virtual ~SimulationFile();
123    
124    /// @brief Close the file
125    virtual void close();
126    /// @brief Flush the current buffered data to the file
127    virtual void flush();
128    /// @brief Create the current checkpoint to the HDF5 file
129    /// @param checkpointFilename Name of the new checkpoint file
130    virtual string checkpoint();
131
132    // Methods for working with parameters.
133    /// @brief Get all the parameters from the current replicate
134    virtual map<string,string> getParameters();
135    /// @brief Get the specified parameter from the current replicate
136    virtual string getParameter(string key, string defaultValue="");
137    /// @brief Set the specified parameter to the value
138    virtual void setParameter(string key, string value);
139
140    // Methods for working with the model.
141    /// @brief Pops the reaction model from the HDF5 file
142    /// @param reactionModel Memory at which to place the reactionModel
143    virtual void getReactionModel(lm::io::ReactionModel * reactionModel);
144    /// @brief Pushes the reaction model into the HDF5 file
145    /// @param reactionModel Memory from which to place the reactionModel
146    virtual void setReactionModel(lm::io::ReactionModel * reactionModel);
147    /// @brief Pops the diffusion model from the HDF5 file
148    /// @param diffusionModel Memory at which to place the diffusionModel
149    virtual void getDiffusionModel(lm::io::DiffusionModel * diffusionModel);
150    /// @brief Pops the diffusion lattice from the HDF5 file
151    /// @param diffusionModel Memoryfrom which to get the lattice
152    /// @param lattice Memory in which to place lattice
153    /// @param latticeMaxSize Total size of the lattice (i.e. number of bytes)
154    /// @param latticeSites Actual lattice site data in byte format
155    /// @param latticeSitesMaxSize Max size of a lattice site (i.e. number of particles it can contain)
156    virtual void getDiffusionModelLattice(lm::io::DiffusionModel * diffusionModel, byte * lattice, size_t latticeMaxSize, byte * latticeSites, size_t latticeSitesMaxSize);
157    /// @brief Pops the diffusion lattice from the HDF5 file
158    /// @param diffusionModel Memoryfrom which to get the lattice
159    /// @param lattice Memory at which to place the lattice
160    virtual void getDiffusionModelLattice(lm::io::DiffusionModel * diffusionModel, lm::rdme::Lattice * lattice);
161    /// @brief Pushes the diffusion model into the HDF5 file
162    /// @param diffusionModel Memory from which to place the diffusionModel
163    virtual void setDiffusionModel(lm::io::DiffusionModel * diffusionModel);
164
165    /// @brief Pushes the diffusion lattice into the HDF5 file
166    /// @param diffusionModel Memoryfrom which to get the lattice
167    /// @param lattice Memory from which to place the lattice - uint8_t particle lattice
168    /// @param latticeSites Memory from which to place lattice contents
169    virtual void setDiffusionModelLattice(lm::io::DiffusionModel * m, uint8_t * lattice, uint8_t * latticeSites);
170
171    /// @brief Pushes the diffusion lattice into the HDF5 file
172    /// @param diffusionModel Memoryfrom which to get the lattice
173    /// @param lattice Memory from which to place the lattice - uint32_t particle lattice
174    /// @param latticeSites Memory from which to place lattice contents
175    virtual void setDiffusionModelLattice(lm::io::DiffusionModel * m, uint32_t * lattice, uint8_t * latticeSites);
176
177    /// @brief Pushes the diffusion lattice into the HDF5 file
178    /// @param diffusionModel Memory from which to get the lattice
179    /// @param lattice Memory from which to place the lattice
180    virtual void setDiffusionModelLattice(lm::io::DiffusionModel * m, lm::rdme::ByteLattice * lattice);
181
182    /// @brief Pushes the diffusion lattice into the HDF5 file
183    /// @param diffusionModel Memory from which to get the lattice
184    /// @param lattice Memory from which to place the lattice
185    virtual void setDiffusionModelLattice(lm::io::DiffusionModel * m, lm::rdme::IntLattice * lattice);
186
187    /// @brief Pushes the spacial model (i.e. obstacles) into the HDF5 file
188    /// @param model The model object
189    virtual void setSpatialModel(lm::io::SpatialModel * model);
190    /// @brief Pops the spacial model (i.e. obstacles) from the HDF5 file
191    /// @param model The model in which to store the object
192    virtual void getSpatialModel(lm::io::SpatialModel * model);
193
194
195    // Methods for working with a replicate.
196    /// @brief Checks if the specified replicate exists
197    /// @param replicate Replicate number
198    /// @return true/false
199    virtual bool replicateExists(unsigned int replicate);
200    /// @brief Opens the specified replicate for reading
201    /// @param replicate Replicate number
202    virtual void openReplicate(unsigned int replicate);
203    /// @brief Appends the species counts in the various sites into the replicate
204    /// @param replicate Replicate number
205    /// @param speciesCounts Protocol buffers object with species counts in lattice
206    virtual void appendSpeciesCounts(unsigned int replicate, lm::io::SpeciesCounts * speciesCounts);
207    /// @brief Appends the lattice to the current replicate
208    /// @param replicate Replicate number
209    /// @param lattice Lattice to add to replicate
210    /// @param latticeData The actual data of the lattice
211    /// @param latticeDataSize The size of the lattice
212    virtual void appendLattice(unsigned int replicate, lm::io::Lattice * lattice, byte * latticeData, size_t latticeDataSize);
213    virtual void appendLattice_U32LE(unsigned int replicate, lm::io::Lattice * lattice, uint32_t * latticeData, size_t latticeDataSize);
214
215    virtual void arbitraryH5(byte *ptr);
216    virtual void arbitraryH5Lookup(byte *in, byte *&out, size_t &out_sz);
217	virtual void appendSites(unsigned int replicate, lm::io::Lattice * lattice, uint8_t * siteData, size_t siteDataSize);
218    /// @brief Adds all the parameter values to the replicate
219    /// @param replicate Replicate number
220    /// @param parameterValues Actual values to store
221    virtual void appendParameterValues(unsigned int replicate, lm::io::ParameterValues * parameterValues);
222    /// @brief Adds all the first passage times to the replicate
223    /// @param replicate Replicate number
224    /// @param speciesCounts Actual passage times to store
225    virtual void setFirstPassageTimes(unsigned int replicate, lm::io::FirstPassageTimes * speciesCounts);
226    /// @brief Get the timestep times for the replicate
227    /// @param replicate Replicate number
228    /// @return A set of timestep times
229    virtual vector<double> getLatticeTimes(unsigned int replicate);
230    /// @brief Get the lattice for the replicate
231    /// @param replicate Replicate number
232    /// @param latticeIndex Seems to be unused...
233    /// @param lattice The lattice object in which to store the data
234    virtual void getLattice(unsigned int replicate, unsigned int latticeIndex, lm::rdme::Lattice * lattice);
235    /// @brief Close the specified replicate
236    /// @param replicate Replicate number
237    virtual void closeReplicate(unsigned int replicate);
238    /// @brief Close all the replicates
239    virtual void closeAllReplicates();
240
241    //virtual void appendSpatialModelObjects(unsigned int replicate, lm::io::SpatialModel * model);
242    //virtual void getSpatialModelObjects(unsigned int replicate, lm::io::SpatialModel * model);
243
244	/*
245    virtual lattice_coord_t getLatticeSize() const;
246	virtual nmdist_t getLatticeSpacing() const;
247	virtual uint getMaxParticlesPerSite() const;
248	virtual lattice_particle_t getMaxParticleType() const;
249	virtual lattice_site_t getMaxSiteType() const;
250	virtual const std::map<uint64,uint64> getMaxParticleCounts() const;
251	virtual const std::map<uint64,uint64> getMaxSiteCounts() const;
252	
253	virtual uint64 getNumberFrames() const;	
254	virtual const std::vector<nstime_t> getFrameTimes() const;
255	virtual void loadFrame(uint64 frameIndex, Lattice* lattice, nstime_t* time=NULL) const;
256	
257	virtual uint64 getNumberLatticeConfigurations() const;
258	virtual const std::vector<nstime_t> getLatticeConfigurationTimes() const;
259	virtual void loadLatticeConfiguration(uint64 latticeIndex, Lattice* lattice, nstime_t* time=NULL) const;
260    */
261
262	std::map<uint32_t, uint> getParticleCounts(unsigned int replicate, unsigned int latticeIndex);
263	std::map<double, vector<int> > getSpeciesCounts(unsigned int replicate);
264	vector<double> getSpeciesCountTimes(unsigned int replicate);
265	std::map<uint, string> getSpeciesNames();
266	std::map<uint, string> getSiteTypeNames();
267
268	
269public:
270
271    /// @struct ReplicateHandles
272    /// @brief A handle for the different replicates that may be stored in the HDF5 file
273    struct ReplicateHandles
274    {
275        hid_t group;                    // ID of the group of replicates
276        hid_t speciesCountsDataset;     // ?
277        hid_t speciesCountTimesDataset; // ?
278        
279        /// @brief Set up the ReplicateHandles
280        ReplicateHandles():group(H5I_INVALID_HID),speciesCountsDataset(H5I_INVALID_HID),speciesCountTimesDataset(H5I_INVALID_HID) {}
281    };
282
283	
284protected:
285    // Protected functions
286    virtual void open();
287    virtual void openGroups();
